children.subject: I think this is a really hard question to answer. I'd go around and talk to grad students to see if they have any work that they can offer you. A lot of grad students are looking for students who are willing to learn and can devote a lot of time (like being able to spend a lot of time on research over the summer is desirable in their eyes). A lot of things they may want you to do are teachable  I don't think there's any specific topic that's particularly "easy" - my guess I'd the only thing that would be more off limits could be things in AI/ML that have a lot of interest and having someone who's taken CS 189 and other related classes is a lot more desirable.

history.content: What kind of eecs research would be suitable with someone who's only taken 61a/b, 16a/b, and cs70 to do productively over the summer?
history.subject: Beginner friendly eecs summer research?
